text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department said it was inviting offers for about 12.3 million pounds of dairy products for February delivery in a bid to cut federal spending by taking advantage of lower market prices.
USDA said it was also seeking offers for January delivery of print butter, March delivery of processed cheese, and March and April delivery of mozzarella cheese.

"This action by CCC (Commodity Credit Corp) to procure additional cheese for later delivery periods should help the nation's dairy producers by removing additional product from the market at this time," Farm Service Agency administrator Grant Buntrock said in a statement.

USDA said letter offers must be received by the Kansas City Commodity Office (KCCO) by 11 a.m. December 17. It said successful offerors will be notified by midnight December 19 and a public announcement will be made December 20. (c) Reuters Limited 1996
